column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Being a New Yorker
column2: I had to stop by Chicago on my way to North Milwaukee
column3: to try some deep dish pizza and see what all the hype was about.  The wait wasn't too bad
column4: 20 minutes.  We ordered the Classic and since it took 30 minutes we ordered the calamari for starters.  I wasn't crazy about their special "cocktail sauce" they paired with the calamari
column5: we just wanted some good old marinara sauce which they brought us eventually (and it was good).  I expected the extra cheese on the pizza to be stringy but it was globs of it instead so I tasted more cheese than anything.  the buttercrust was okay
column6: i guess i like my crust crunchy and not corn mealy (sp?)
